intro: Begonia erythrofolia, commonly known as the red-leaf begonia, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety, deep red foliage that contrasts beautifully with its delicate white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the leaf axils. Begonia erythrofolia is popular as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and ease of cultivation.
